text: I'm having trouble to install a private github package. I tried with the ssh version, which should work with my current ssh key. This fails (repository not found). I also tried with https, which asks me multiple times for my username and password. I'm sure they're correct, yet it fails after multiple tries. I'm on 1.6 on mac, any ideas what I could try?

elements.text: I'm having trouble to install a private github package. I tried with the ssh version, which should work with my current ssh key. This fails (repository not found). I also tried with https, which asks me multiple times for my username and password. I'm sure they're correct, yet it fails after multiple tries. I'm on 1.6 on mac, any ideas what I could try?

text: are you using two factor auth? I think maybe you need to use a token or something instead of the password

elements.text: are you using two factor auth? I think maybe you need to use a token or something instead of the password

text: but a ssh key should work too

elements.text: but a ssh key should work too

text: I'm starting to suspect it might be because the package is part of an organization which I'm a member of. because I just tried with a private package of my own (which is not even a Julia package) but at least there it said "no package file found" and not "repository not found"

elements.text: I'm starting to suspect it might be because the package is part of an organization which I'm a member of. because I just tried with a private package of my own (which is not even a Julia package) but at least there it said "no package file found" and not "repository not found"

text: It's my PI's lab's organization, and I maintain the package, so I'm not sure why my ssh key would be a problem

elements.text: It's my PI's lab's organization, and I maintain the package, so I'm not sure why my ssh key would be a problem

text: I think there are some issues around julia using libgit2 instead of commandline git, and libgit2 has different requirements and config

elements.text: I think there are some issues around julia using libgit2 instead of commandline git, and libgit2 has different requirements and config

text: <https://julialang.slack.com/archives/C67EFTEF3/p1617638425100600> is about windows but I think maybe some of it carries over?

attachments.fallback: [April 5th, 2021 9:00 AM] ibutter: Does anyone have a good “setting julia 1.6 up with ssh keys on Windows 10 for dummies” guide, so that private registries and repos work? Right down to the details of how to install ssh keys on windows
